memberdef.argsstring: (const Array &array1, const Array &array2, const int iterations=500, const Array *p_mask=nullptr)
memberdef.name: blend_poisson_bf

briefdescription.para: Blends two arrays using Poisson blending with a brute-force solver.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs Poisson blending between array1 and array2 over a specified number of iterations. Optionally, a mask can be provided to control the blending regions.

parameterdescription.para: The first input array.
The second input array.
The number of iterations for the blending process (default: 500).
Optional pointer to an array defining the blending mask. If null, blending is applied globally.

simplesect.para: The blended array resulting from the Poisson blending operation.

memberdef.argsstring: (Array &z, int nparticles, int seed, Array *p_bedrock=nullptr, Array *p_moisture_map=nullptr, Array *p_erosion_map=nullptr, Array *p_deposition_map=nullptr, float c_capacity=10.f, float c_erosion=0.05f, float c_deposition=0.05f, float c_inertia=0.3f, float drag_rate=0.001f, float evap_rate=0.001f, bool post_filtering=false)
memberdef.name: hydraulic_particle

memberdef.argsstring: (Array &z, Array *p_mask, int nparticles, int seed, Array *p_bedrock=nullptr, Array *p_moisture_map=nullptr, Array *p_erosion_map=nullptr, Array *p_deposition_map=nullptr, float c_capacity=10.f, float c_erosion=0.05f, float c_deposition=0.05f, float c_inertia=0.3f, float drag_rate=0.001f, float evap_rate=0.001f, bool post_filtering=false)
memberdef.name: hydraulic_particle

memberdef.argsstring: (Array &z, int iterations, const Array &talus, float c_erosion=1.f, float c_thermal=0.1f, float c_deposition=0.2f, float flow_acc_exponent=0.8f, float flow_acc_exponent_depo=0.8f, float flow_routing_exponent=1.3f, float thermal_weight=1.5f, float deposition_weight=2.5f, Array *p_flow=nullptr)
memberdef.name: hydraulic_schott

briefdescription.para: Simulates hydraulic erosion and deposition on a heightmap using the Schott method.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs hydraulic erosion on the given heightmap z over a specified number of iterations. It includes parameters for controlling erosion, deposition, and flow routing. Optional flow accumulation can also be computed and stored in the p_flow array.

parameterdescription.para: The heightmap array to be modified. Heights are updated in-place.
The number of iterations for the hydraulic erosion process.
An array defining the slope threshold for erosion.
Erosion coefficient (default: 1.0f).
Thermal erosion coefficient (default: 0.1f).
Deposition coefficient (default: 0.2f).
Exponent controlling the influence of flow accumulation on erosion (default: 0.8f).
Exponent controlling the influence of flow accumulation on deposition (default: 0.8f).
Exponent controlling flow routing behavior (default: 1.3f).
Weight of thermal erosion effects (default: 1.5f).
Weight of deposition effects (default: 2.5f).
Optional pointer to an array for storing flow accumulation data. If null, flow data is not returned (default: nullptr).

simplesect.para: Taken from https://hal.science/hal-04565030v1/document
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (Array &z, int iterations, const Array &talus, Array *p_mask, float c_erosion=1.f, float c_thermal=0.1f, float c_deposition=0.2f, float flow_acc_exponent=0.8f, float flow_acc_exponent_depo=0.8f, float flow_routing_exponent=1.3f, float thermal_weight=1.5f, float deposition_weight=2.5f, Array *p_flow=nullptr)
memberdef.name: hydraulic_schott

memberdef.name: thermal_scree

briefdescription.para: Performs thermal scree erosion on a heightmap.

detaileddescription.para: This function applies a thermal erosion process that redistributes material from steeper slopes to flatter areas, simulating talus formation. The process iterates a given number of times to achieve a more stable terrain profile.

parameterdescription.para: The heightmap to be modified in-place by the erosion process.
The threshold slope angles that determine where material is moved.
The maximum allowed elevation for erosion effects.
The number of erosion iterations to apply (default: 10).
Whether to enforce a constraint on the talus slope (default: true).
Optional pointer to an array that stores the deposited material per cell.

memberdef.argsstring: (Array &z, const Array *p_mask, const Array &talus, const Array &zmax, int iterations=10, bool talus_constraint=true, Array *p_deposition_map=nullptr)

memberdef.name: basalt_field

briefdescription.para: Generates a synthetic procedural terrain resembling basaltic landforms.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a multi-scale procedural field combining large, medium, and small-scale Voronoi-based patterns, noise warping, and optional flattening, simulating the morphology of fractured basalt or volcanic terrains. The terrain is constructed using a combination of Voronoi diagrams (via voronoi_fbm) and fractal noise (noise_fbm), layered with frequency-domain manipulations and amplitude/gain controls at each scale.

The final output is a heightmap represented as an Array, normalized and composed of:
Large-scale cellular patterns with smoothed Voronoi edge distances.
Medium and small-scale structures introducing finer surface variation.
Optional rugosity (fine detail) and flattening to simulate erosion or flow effects.

parameterdescription.para: Output resolution (width x height) of the field.
Base wave numbers (frequency) for the terrain features.
Initial seed used for deterministic random generation.
Frequency of the warping noise that displaces Voronoi positions.
Amplitude of displacement for large-scale Voronoi warping.
Gain adjustment applied to the large-scale features.
Final amplitude of the large-scale height contribution.
Scaling factor for the frequency of the medium-scale patterns.
Amplitude of warping for the medium-scale displacement.
Gain control for medium-scale modulation.
Amplitude of the medium-scale heightmap.
Frequency ratio for small-scale details.
Amplitude of small-scale pattern contribution.
Additional overlay strength for repeating the small-scale pattern.
Frequency ratio for high-frequency noise applied as fine roughness.
Strength of the rugosity (high-frequency modulation).
Enables or disables the final flattening operation.
Frequency scaling of the flattening noise field.
Amplitude control of the flattening operation.
Optional pointer to a noise field used to displace grid coordinates in X.
Optional pointer to a noise field used to displace grid coordinates in Y.
The 2D bounding box ({xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax}) over which the terrain is generated.

simplesect.para: A procedurally generated Array representing the synthetic basalt-like terrain field.

listitem.para: This function relies on OpenCL-based kernels via the gpu:: namespace.
The returned field is normalized in amplitude but may require rescaling to match specific physical units.
Adjusting seed, warp_kw, and the gain/amplitude values can produce a wide variety of terrain features.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, const Array &angle, float angle_spread_ratio=1.f, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: gabor_wave

briefdescription.para: Return an array filled with coherence Gabor noise.

parameterdescription.para: Array shape.
Noise wavenumbers {kx, ky} for each directions.
Random seed number.
Base orientation angle for the Gabor wavelets (in radians). Defaults to 0.
Ratio that controls the spread of wave orientations around the base angle. Defaults to 1.
Domain bounding box.

simplesect.para: Array Fractal noise.
Taken from https://www.shadertoy.com/view/clGyWm
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, float angle=0.f, float angle_spread_ratio=1.f, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: gabor_wave

memberdef.name: gabor_wave_fbm

briefdescription.para: Return an array filled with coherence Gabor noise.

parameterdescription.para: Array shape.
Noise wavenumbers {kx, ky} for each directions.
Random seed number.
Base orientation angle for the Gabor wavelets (in radians). Defaults to 0.
Ratio that controls the spread of wave orientations around the base angle. Defaults to 1.
Number of octaves.
Octave weighting.
Octave persistence.
Defines the wavenumber ratio between each octaves.
Reference to the control parameter array (acts as a multiplier for the weight parameter).
Reference to the input noise arrays.
Domain bounding box.

simplesect.para: Array Fractal noise.
Taken from https://www.shadertoy.com/view/clGyWm
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.

memberdef.name: gabor_wave_fbm

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, const Array &angle, float amplitude=0.05f, float angle_spread_ratio=1.f, Vec2< float > kw_multiplier={4.f, 4.f}, float slope_strength=1.f, float branch_strength=2.f, float z_cut_min=0.2f, float z_cut_max=1.f, int octaves=8, float persistence=0.4f, float lacunarity=2.f, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: gavoronoise

briefdescription.para: Generates a 2D array using the GavoroNoise algorithm, which is a procedural noise technique for terrain generation and other applications.

detaileddescription.para:
shape
Dimensions of the output array.
kw
Wave number vector controlling the noise frequency.
seed
Seed value for random number generation.
amplitude
Amplitude of the noise.
kw_multiplier
Multiplier for wave numbers in the noise function.
slope_strength
Strength of slope-based directional erosion in the noise.
branch_strength
Strength of branch-like structures in the generated noise.
z_cut_min
Minimum cutoff for Z-value in the noise.
z_cut_max
Maximum cutoff for Z-value in the noise.
octaves
Number of octaves for fractal Brownian motion (fBm).
persistence
Amplitude scaling factor between noise octaves.
lacunarity
Frequency scaling factor between noise octaves.
p_ctrl_param
Optional array for control parameters, can modify the Z cutoff dynamically.
p_noise_x
Optional array for X-axis noise perturbation.
p_noise_y
Optional array for Y-axis noise perturbation.
bbox
Bounding box for mapping grid coordinates to world space.
A 2D array containing the generated GavoroNoise values.
Taken from https://www.shadertoy.com/view/MtGcWh
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.
This function leverages an OpenCL kernel to compute the GavoroNoise values on the GPU, allowing for efficient large-scale generation. The kernel applies a combination of fractal Brownian motion (fBm), directional erosion, and other procedural techniques to generate intricate noise patterns.
The optional p_ctrl_param, p_noise_x, and p_noise_y buffers provide additional flexibility for dynamically adjusting noise parameters and perturbations.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, float angle=0.f, float amplitude=0.05f, float angle_spread_ratio=1.f, Vec2< float > kw_multiplier={4.f, 4.f}, float slope_strength=1.f, float branch_strength=2.f, float z_cut_min=0.2f, float z_cut_max=1.f, int octaves=8, float persistence=0.4f, float lacunarity=2.f, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: gavoronoise

memberdef.argsstring: (const Array &base, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, float amplitude=0.05f, Vec2< float > kw_multiplier={4.f, 4.f}, float slope_strength=1.f, float branch_strength=2.f, float z_cut_min=0.2f, float z_cut_max=1.f, int octaves=8, float persistence=0.4f, float lacunarity=2.f, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: gavoronoise

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, float half_width=0.2f, float angle_spread_ratio=0.5f, float core_size_ratio=1.f, Vec2< float > center={0.5f, 0.5f}, int octaves=8, float weight=0.7f, float persistence=0.5f, float lacunarity=2.f, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, const Array *p_angle=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: mountain_range_radial

briefdescription.para: Generates a heightmap representing a radial mountain range.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a heightmap that simulates a mountain range emanating radially from a specified center. The mountain range is influenced by various noise parameters and control attributes.

parameterdescription.para: The dimensions of the output heightmap as a 2D vector.
The wave numbers (frequency components) as a 2D vector.
The seed for random noise generation.
The half-width of the radial mountain range, controlling its spread. Default is 0.2f.
The ratio controlling the angular spread of the mountain range. Default is 0.5f.
The center point of the radial mountain range as normalized coordinates within [0, 1]. Default is {0.5f, 0.5f}.
The number of octaves for fractal noise generation. Default is 8.
The initial weight for noise contribution. Default is 0.7f.
The amplitude scaling factor for subsequent noise octaves. Default is 0.5f.
The frequency scaling factor for subsequent noise octaves. Default is 2.0f.
Optional pointer to an array of control parameters influencing the terrain generation.
Optional pointer to a precomputed noise array for the X-axis.
Optional pointer to a precomputed noise array for the Y-axis.
Optional pointer to an array to output the angle.
The bounding box of the output heightmap in normalized coordinates [xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]. Default is {0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f}.

simplesect.para: Array The generated heightmap representing the radial mountain range.
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (NoiseType noise_type, Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, const Array *p_stretching=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: noise

memberdef.argsstring: (NoiseType noise_type, Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, int octaves=8, float weight=0.7f, float persistence=0.5f, float lacunarity=2.f, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, const Array *p_stretching=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: noise_fbm

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, float density, uint seed, float k_smoothing=0.f, float exp_sigma=0.f, float alpha=0.f, float alpha_span=M_PI, VoronoiReturnType return_type=VoronoiReturnType::F1_SQUARED, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f}, Vec4< float > bbox_points={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: vorolines

briefdescription.para: Generates a Voronoi-based pattern where cells are defined by proximity to random lines.

detaileddescription.para: This function generates an OpenCL-accelerated Voronoi-like pattern based on the distance from each pixel to a set of randomly oriented lines. Each line is defined by a random point and a direction sampled from a uniform distribution around a given angle.

parameterdescription.para: The resolution of the resulting 2D array (width, height).
Number of base points per unit area used to define lines.
Seed for the random number generator used to generate base points and directions.
Kernel smoothing factor; controls how sharp or soft the distance fields are.
Exponential smoothing parameter applied to the computed distance field.
Base angle (in radians) used to orient the generated lines.
Maximum angular deviation from alpha; controls line orientation variability.
Type of Voronoi output to return (e.g., F1, F2, edge distance, smoothed field, etc.).
Optional pointer to an input noise field applied to the X coordinates (can be nullptr).
Optional pointer to an input noise field applied to the Y coordinates (can be nullptr).
Bounding box in normalized coordinates (min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y) of the final array.
Bounding box within which random base points are sampled.

simplesect.para: A 2D array (of type Array) containing the computed distance field based on line proximity.
Each line is defined from a point (x, y) to a direction offset using angle theta = alpha + rand * alpha_span.
The OpenCL kernel "vorolines" must be defined and compiled beforehand.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, float density, uint seed, float k_smoothing=0.f, float exp_sigma=0.f, float alpha=0.f, float alpha_span=M_PI, VoronoiReturnType return_type=VoronoiReturnType::F1_SQUARED, int octaves=8, float weight=0.7f, float persistence=0.5f, float lacunarity=2.f, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f}, Vec4< float > bbox_points={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: vorolines_fbm

briefdescription.para: Generates a Voronoi-based pattern using distances to lines defined by random points and angles, with additional fractal Brownian motion (fBm) noise modulation.

detaileddescription.para: This function extends the standard vorolines generation by introducing fBm-based warping of the coordinate space, resulting in more organic and fractal-like structures. It creates a Voronoi distance field based on proximity to oriented line segments and distorts the result using multi-octave procedural noise.

parameterdescription.para: Output resolution of the 2D array (width, height).
Number of base points per unit area used to define lines.
Seed value for the random number generator.
Kernel smoothing coefficient to soften distance values (e.g., for blending).
Sigma value for optional exponential smoothing on the final field.
Base orientation angle (in radians) of lines generated from random points.
Maximum angle deviation from alpha, determining directional randomness of lines.
Type of output to return (e.g., F1, F2, distance to edge, smoothed version).
Number of noise octaves used in the fBm modulation.
Weight of each octave's contribution to the total noise.
Amplitude decay factor for each successive octave (commonly 0.50.8).
Frequency multiplier for each successive octave (commonly 2.0).
Optional pointer to an external noise field applied to X coordinates (can be nullptr).
Optional pointer to an external noise field applied to Y coordinates (can be nullptr).
Bounding box for the final image domain (min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y).
Bounding box from which the initial set of points are sampled.

simplesect.para: A 2D Array representing the Voronoi-fBm field, distorted by noise and influenced by distance to random lines.
This version uses internally computed fBm noise unless external fields (p_noise_x, p_noise_y) are provided.
This function requires an OpenCL kernel named "vorolines_fbm" to be compiled and accessible.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, Vec2< float > jitter={0.5f, 0.5f}, float k_smoothing=0.f, float exp_sigma=0.f, VoronoiReturnType return_type=VoronoiReturnType::F1_SQUARED, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: voronoi

briefdescription.para: Generates a Voronoi diagram in a 2D array with configurable properties.

parameterdescription.para: The dimensions of the output array as a 2D vector of integers.
The frequency scale factors for the Voronoi cells, given as a 2D vector of floats.
A seed value for random number generation, ensuring reproducibility.
(Optional) The amount of random variation in the positions of Voronoi cell sites, given as a 2D vector of floats. Defaults to {0.5f, 0.5f}.
(Optional) The type of value to compute for the Voronoi diagram. Defaults to VoronoiReturnType::F1_SQUARED.
(Optional) A pointer to an Array used to control the Voronoi computation. Used here as a multiplier for the jitter. If nullptr, no control is applied.
(Optional) A pointer to an Array providing additional noise in the x-direction for cell positions. If nullptr, no x-noise is applied.
(Optional) A pointer to an Array providing additional noise in the y-direction for cell positions. If nullptr, no y-noise is applied.
(Optional) The bounding box for the Voronoi computation, given as a 4D vector of floats representing {min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y}. Defaults to {0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f}.

simplesect.para: A 2D array representing the generated Voronoi diagram.
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, Vec2< float > jitter={0.5f, 0.5f}, float k_smoothing=0.f, float exp_sigma=0.f, VoronoiReturnType return_type=VoronoiReturnType::F1_SQUARED, int octaves=8, float weight=0.7f, float persistence=0.5f, float lacunarity=2.f, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: voronoi_fbm

briefdescription.para: Generates a Voronoi diagram in a 2D array with configurable properties.

parameterdescription.para: The dimensions of the output array as a 2D vector of integers.
The frequency scale factors for the base Voronoi cells, given as a 2D vector of floats.
A seed value for random number generation, ensuring reproducibility.
(Optional) The amount of random variation in the positions of Voronoi cell sites, given as a 2D vector of floats. Defaults to {0.5f, 0.5f}.
(Optional) The type of value to compute for the Voronoi diagram. Defaults to VoronoiReturnType::F1_SQUARED.
(Optional) The number of layers (octaves) in the fractal Brownian motion. Defaults to 8.
(Optional) The initial weight of the base layer in the FBM computation. Defaults to 0.7f.
(Optional) The persistence factor that controls the amplitude reduction between octaves. Defaults to 0.5f.
(Optional) The lacunarity factor that controls the frequency increase between octaves. Defaults to 2.f.
(Optional) A pointer to an Array used to control the Voronoi computation. If nullptr, no control is applied.
(Optional) A pointer to an Array providing additional noise in the x-direction for cell positions. If nullptr, no x-noise is applied.
(Optional) A pointer to an Array providing additional noise in the y-direction for cell positions. If nullptr, no y-noise is applied.
(Optional) The bounding box for the Voronoi computation, given as a 4D vector of floats representing {min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y}. Defaults to {0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f}.

simplesect.para: A 2D array representing the generated Voronoi diagram.
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, uint seed, Vec2< float > jitter={0.5f, 0.5f}, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: voronoi_edge_distance

parameterdescription.para: The shape of the grid as a 2D vector (width, height).
The weights for the Voronoi kernel as a 2D vector.
The random seed used for generating Voronoi points.
Optional parameter for controlling jitter in Voronoi point placement (default is {0.5f, 0.5f}).
Optional pointer to an Array specifying control parameters for Voronoi grid jitter (default is nullptr).
Reference to the input noise arrays.
The bounding box for the Voronoi diagram as {x_min, x_max, y_min, y_max} (default is {0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f}).

simplesect.para: Taken from https://www.shadertoy.com/view/llG3zy
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.
The resulting Array has the same dimensions as the input shape.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, float u_param, float v_param, uint seed, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: voronoise

detaileddescription.para: This function computes a Voronoi noise pattern based on the input parameters and returns it as a 2D array. The noise is calculated in the OpenCL kernel noise_voronoise, which uses a combination of hashing and smoothstep functions to generate a weighted Voronoi noise field.

simplesect.para: Taken from https://www.shadertoy.com/view/Xd23Dh
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: The dimensions of the 2D output array as a vector (width and height).
Wave numbers for scaling the noise pattern, represented as a 2D vector.
A control parameter for the noise, adjusting the contribution of random offsets.
A control parameter for the noise, affecting the smoothness of the pattern.
Optional pointer to an Array specifying control parameters for Voronoi grid jitter (default is nullptr).
Reference to the input noise arrays.
A seed value for random number generation, ensuring reproducibility.

simplesect.para: An Array object containing the generated 2D Voronoi noise values.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, Vec2< float > kw, float u_param, float v_param, uint seed, int octaves=8, float weight=0.7f, float persistence=0.5f, float lacunarity=2.f, const Array *p_ctrl_param=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: voronoise_fbm

briefdescription.para: Return an array filled with coherence Voronoise.

parameterdescription.para: Array shape.
Noise wavenumbers {kx, ky} for each directions.
Random seed number.
Number of octaves.
Octave weighting.
Octave persistence.
Defines the wavenumber ratio between each octaves.
Reference to the control parameter array (acts as a multiplier for the weight parameter).
Reference to the input noise arrays.
Domain bounding box.

simplesect.para: Array Fractal noise.
Taken from https://www.shadertoy.com/view/clGyWm
Only available if OpenCL is enabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, float density, float variability, uint seed, float k_smoothing=0.f, float exp_sigma=0.f, VoronoiReturnType return_type=VoronoiReturnType::F1_SQUARED, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f}, Vec4< float > bbox_points={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: vororand

briefdescription.para: Generates a 2D Voronoi-based scalar field using OpenCL.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes a Voronoi diagram or derived metric (such as F1, F2, or edge distances) on a grid of given shape. A set of random points is generated within an extended bounding box, based on the desired density and variability, to reduce edge artifacts. Optionally, per-pixel displacement can be applied through noise fields.
The result is stored in an Array object representing a 2D scalar field.

parameterdescription.para: Dimensions of the output array (width x height).
Number of random points per unit area for Voronoi diagram.
Amount of randomness added to the point generation bounding box.
Seed for random number generation used in point sampling.
Smoothing factor used in soft minimum/maximum Voronoi distance computations.
Standard deviation used in exponential falloff for edge distance computation.
Type of Voronoi computation to perform (e.g., F1, F2, F2-F1, edge distance).
Optional pointer to a noise field applied to X coordinates of grid points.
Optional pointer to a noise field applied to Y coordinates of grid points.
Bounding box of the domain in which the field is computed: {xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax}.
Bounding box for point generation, usually larger than bbox to avoid edge effects.

simplesect.para: An Array object containing the computed scalar field.

listitem.para: The kernel "vororand" must be compiled and available in the OpenCL context.
If p_noise_x or p_noise_y are provided, they must match the shape of the output array.
The generated point cloud will be larger than bbox to reduce border artifacts.

memberdef.argsstring: (Vec2< int > shape, const std::vector< float > &xp, const std::vector< float > &yp, float k_smoothing=0.f, float exp_sigma=0.f, VoronoiReturnType return_type=VoronoiReturnType::F1_SQUARED, const Array *p_noise_x=nullptr, const Array *p_noise_y=nullptr, Vec4< float > bbox={0.f, 1.f, 0.f, 1.f})
memberdef.name: vororand
